# Government Tender Announcement (Expired)

## Title (English and French)
- **OPMC Request for Proposal** (English): Conception and Production of ExpoJeu
- **SVPM Demande de Propositions** (French): Conception et production ExpoJeu

## Contract Details
- **Reference Number**: PW-22-01005289
- **Amendment Number**: 1
- **Solicitation Number**: DDPINT-310-22-1542
- **Publication Date**: August 24, 2022
- **Tender Closing Date**: Closed (exceeded on September 28, 2022, at 11:00 a.m.)
- **Amendment Date**: September 12, 2022
- **Contract Duration**: To be Determined (start and end dates are not specified)

## Tender Description and Requirements
The Old Port Montréal, as a client, has issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the conception, creation, and production of a new exposition at the Montreal Science Center. Proposals should detail the bid price, a detailed project plan, and relevant credentials of the proposer. The project objectives, requirements, and guidelines for submission are outlined in the Scope of Work Schedule, which is attached to the tender documents (available online at [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/)).

## Qualified Bidders
This tender is open to qualified bidders with expertise in multimedia services, exposition design, fabrication, and production. Bidders must confirm their qualifications and technical capabilities as specified in the tender documents.

## Solicitation Method
This RFP invites qualified bidders to submit a proposal in compliance with the requirement specifications outlined in the attached tender documents. Only complete proposals submitted in accordance with the instructions will be processed for evaluation.

## Evaluation Criteria
Evaluation of proposals will be based on relevance, completeness, and the overall quality of the work proposed. This includes compliance with the client's requirements, bid price, technical proposal, balance of qualifications, and post-proposal evaluation matrix.

## Trade Agreement Compliance
The proposed work is governed by standard trade agreements, including the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), the Agreement on Government Procurement of the World Trade Organization (WTO GPA), and other recognized trade agreements applicable to the proposed work in Quebec (excluding the National Capital Region).

## Documents
Tender documents can be downloaded online from [Canada Buys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/
